brief_summary.textblock:
This study will evaluate feasibility and acceptability of providing the Dignity Therapy/Life
      Plan intervention to newly-diagnosed pancreatic cancer patients presenting for initial
      chemotherapy in the outpatient medical oncology setting. Investigators hypothesize that
      providing dignity therapy to this population will be feasible.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dignity Therapy/Life Plan in Patients With Pancreatic Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age >18

          -  Undergoing initial chemotherapy for pancreatic adenocarcinoma (within 3 months of
             diagnosis)

          -  English-speaking

          -  Cognitively intact, per clinician judgment, as documented in electronic medical
             record (EMR)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Currently receiving hospice or palliative care services

          -  Concurrent diagnosis of delirium or dementia, per medical record

          -  Diagnosis of major depression disorder, acute anxiety disorder or schizophrenia per
             medical record

          -  Participating in other psychosocial intervention research studies.

intervention.description: Dignity Therapy/Life Plan will be provided by an advanced practice nurse or chaplain (APN/Chap), who has undergone training in provision of Dignity Therapy (offered through a 3-day group workshop by Dr. Harvey Chochinov).

clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/IIA: Dignity Therapy/Life Plan in Patients With Pancreatic Cancer

primary_outcome.measure: Change in level of distress as measured by distress scores on the Distress Thermometer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline & at the end of the diginity therapy intervention (approximately 6 weeks)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Ann (Ann Marie) M. Dose, R.N., Ph.D.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
